comment.author: 59356674@N05
comment._content: Sir William Henry Manning was the Treasurer of the  Executive Council of Nyasaland under the first Governor, Sir Alfred Sharpe, in 1907.

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: Malawi, not Botswana.  Manning first arrived in B.C.A. in 1893 as an army Lieutenant in charge of a company of Sikhs from India.  He rose to the rank of Brigadier, became Commander of the King's African Rifles, and was Governor of Nyasaland 1907-1908 and 1911-1913.  Fort Manning, now Mchinji, on the border with Zambia, was built by him during a campaign against the Angoni chief  Mpezeni.
